alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Niagara; Northern Erie; Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Watch issued December 20 at 8:49PM EST until December 24 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding possible. * WHERE...Niagara, Erie, and Chautauqua counties. * WHEN...From Friday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...The rapid rise in water levels may result in lakeshore flooding along the Lake Erie and Upper Niagara River shores. Along the Lake Erie shore, flooding is possible along Route 5 in Hamburg, Buffalo Harbor and Canalside, Dunkirk Harbor, and other flood prone locations. Along the Upper Niagara River, flooding may occur on Grand Island and Cayuga Island. Very high wave action may also result in significant shoreline erosion.
info.instruction: A Lakeshore Flood Watch means that conditions favorable for lakeshore flooding are expected to develop. Residents on or near the shore should take action to protect property, and listen to local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for later statements or warnings.
